txt.en: 'Last I heard from the Quartermaster, the soldiers at Dhúrstrok need more weapons.'
'Those dwarves are trapped in Gazat-fark, working on that shipment.'
Talk to Shúkurz
'You know the drill! Hand over everything or die. Your choice!'
'Looks like you've made your choice!'
Talk to Shúkurz
DNT
Talk to Shúkurz
The time has come to interrogate the Orc prisoner.
Talk to Shúkurz
Filled weapon barrels ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Listen to the interrogation
'That's why I want to leave. Far as I'm concerned, there's only death left for me if I stay in Gundabad.\n\n'I-I mean no harm, honest.'
You should follow Féli to the interrogation and see what happens.
Talk to Náin
You should continue interrogating Shúkurz.
Delivered orders to Orc soldiers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Be wary, my friend, for the Orc speaks poisoned words. What does his kind care for other than destruction and slaughter? I've been faced with many a difficult choice throughout the years, but this situation is simple enough to understand.\n\n'Still, I was... wrong to pull out the Black Mattock. The Orc may be luring us into a trap, but Féli is right. If there truly are dwarves to be saved, then we cannot leave them to their fates.'
Troops sent out to war ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Troops sent out to war ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
You should continue interrogating Shúkurz.
Weapon barrels filled ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'I've been told that ever since Bolg rallied folks to Erebor, things have gone downhill for us. Still, we didn't have outright war for a while; we were just surviving. Suppose you could call it a sort of peace.'
You should talk to the Orc captain.
You should continue interrogating Shúkurz.
'But peace never lasts, not for us. Mordor came calling, and Gorgar answered.'
You should continue observing the interrogation.
'You! Quit standing around like a limp worm! Don't you know we're about to go to war?\n\n'Fill up the barrels 'round camp with weapons and deliver these orders to soldiers. Make it quick!'
Náin wishes to speak with you.
'I want out -- out of Gundabad, out of this entire mess.'
'Been stocking up, waiting for the right time.'
'Worse than bad....'
'Gorgar emptied Gundabad, like his father before him.'
'I was one of the lucky few who survived that battle at Dale.'
'But so was Gorgar. He wouldn't stop bragging about killing the Dwarf-king.'
Talk to the Orc captain
'We knew he was lying.'
'Enough of this. You fought at Dale. You heard Gorgar lie and gloat about killing my father.'
'And just when you think things can't get any worse...'
Fill weapon barrels ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'There is no honour to be found among your people, Orc.'
DNT
'Watch it! Hobgoblins incoming!'
Deliver orders to Orc soldiers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Lord Náin! He still needs to tell us about the missing smiths.'
'We asked Gorgar for reinforcements ages ago. Where're they?!'
'Hah! He'd sooner flee from hobgoblins.'
'If there's a chance of saving them, these claims should be investigated.'
'You want Gorgar's generals to drag you out to Dhúrstrok?'
DNT
'You're useless then. That makes things easy.'
'Lord Náin has agreed to let me ask the questions.'
'However, that won't stop him from interjecting.'
Return to Shúkurz and listen to his story
'I'll do my best to intervene if things get heated.'
'Thank you for your cooperation.'
'Come, let us continue talking.'
'Go ahead, Féli.'
'Now then... why were you hoarding supplies?'
Listen to the interrogation
Talk to Féli

'The end of the war brought trouble. Wasn't long before the hobgoblins came down from the north to overthrow Gorgar and claim Gundabad for themselves.\n\n''Course, I don't need to tell you the end of that story, do I?'
'Are things really that bad?'
'Then watch your tongue, before you're executed for being a traitor!'
'Now, less talking, more preparing to kill!'
There are empty weapon barrels and Orc soldiers waiting on orders throughout the camp.\n\nYou should fill the barrels and deliver orders.
'Bugger off!'
Talk to Shúkurz
'[placeholder], a word.'
Watch events unfold
'Hey, you! Help me out! Don't let them win!'
DNT
Defeat the hobgoblin raiders

'Gorgar would leave us to die and his generals would execute us for deserting. Right then I knew. Didn't matter if I was fighting hobgoblins, dwarves, or my own people -- if I kept fighting for Gorgar, I'd find myself bleeding out one day.\n\n'After we lost the war in Elderslade, I'd hoped for a rebellion but, well... fear is a useful tool for dividing people.'
You should return to Shúkurz and continue listening to his story.
Féli is waiting for you before he starts the interrogation.
Return to Shúkurz and listen to his story
You should continue interrogating Shúkurz.
'My lord, please let me continue. Shúkurz, do you know where Gorgar is?'
You should watch the events before you unfold.

'Thank you, [placeholder]. It's unpleasant business, but it helps to have another person who isn't as openly hostile. I have worked with Lord Náin for years and respect him in the utmost, but sometimes his distrust can lead to tricky situations.

'Even if we aim to defeat Gorgar, we are woefully unprepared. We need more information before we can act -- not just about Gorgar's location, but also those closest to him. And what of the hobgoblins? Where does the power truly lie? I do not know how quickly we'll find these answers. But acting rashly won't get us far, either.

'As it stands right now, this Orc -- Shúkurz -- knows more than we do currently. It would be prudent to give him the benefit of the doubt and proceed cautiously.'
'He's at Dhúrstrok with his generals.'
You should defeat the hobgoblin raiders.
'B-but I'm not telling you where Dhúrstrok is until you agree to help me!'
You should return to Shúkurz and continue listening to his story.
You should continue interrogating Shúkurz.
Instance: The Truth of the Matter
